column4: some keeps breaking into my wireless router, how can i monitor the traffic?
is there such software in ubuntu?
stop using wep
it's a fairly simple operation... stop using WEP. use wpa2 instead
my router is old
then you're out of luck
unless your router allows you to whitelist mac addresses
the other thing i tell my friends to do (who insist on using wifi) is to turn off dhcp and use static ips in non standard ip ranges
yes
you'll also need a separate device for the wifi access point and internet access
i assume your internet access device is the same thing as your wifi device ?
are they the same device ?
i would just check first to see if your wlan router allows you to whitelist wifi clients by mac address
thanks, i think i saw an option. i'll try that...
also
you may have an option to broadcast the AP name... turn that off to make the accesspoint invisible.
will the invisibility prevent legitimate users also?
it will weed out the nubs. whitelisting will prevent machines that you don't allow to connect
i would also think about getting a new wifi router (they are fairly cheap now)
yeah, i think i'll probably go ahead and do that
well calling your access point a router is flimsy concept
